topic.name: Monsters
topic.para: This material is Open Game Content, and is licensed for public use under the terms of the Open Game License v1.0a.

topic.name: Monsters
topic.para: Monsters (Animals)

This section provides statistics and basic information for many common kinds of mundane animals. These creatures generally operate on instinct, driven by simple needs such as food and reproduction. Most animals, even predators, do not attack unless they or their young are threatened.
Animals are not capable of detailed reasoning, although with the Handle Animal skill it is possible to tame an animal and teach it to perform certain tricks.

Some herbivorous animals do not normally use their natural weapons to attack. As such, their natural weapons are treated as secondary attacks. The animal's attack and damage entries note this fact, with an explanatory footnote.

topic.name: Animal Traits
topic.para: Animal Traits: An animal possesses the following traits (unless otherwise noted in a creature's entry).

list.item: Intelligence score of 1 or 2 (no creature with an Intelligence score of 3 or higher can be an animal).

topic.para: -Alignment: Always neutral. Animals are not governed by a human sense of morality.
-Treasure: None. Animals never possess treasure.

topic.name: Ape
topic.para: Ape

cell.para: Str 21, Dex 15, Con 14, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 7

topic.para: These powerful omnivores resemble gorillas but are far more aggressive; they kill and eat anything they can catch. An adult male ape is 5-1/2 to 6 feet tall and weighs 300 to 400 pounds.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: Apes have a +8 racial bonus on Climb checks and can always choose to take 10 on Climb checks, even if rushed or threatened.

topic.name: Baboon
topic.para: Baboon

cell.para: Str 15, Dex 14, Con 12, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 4

topic.para: Baboons are powerful and aggressive primates adapted to life on the ground. They prefer open spaces but climb trees to find safe places to rest overnight. A typical baboon is the size of a big dog.
Males can be 2 to 4 feet long and weigh as much as 90 pounds.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
Baboons usually attack in groups.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: Baboons have a +8 racial bonus on Climb checks and can always choose to take 10 on Climb checks, even if rushed or threatened.

topic.name: Badger
topic.para: Badger

cell.para: Str 8, Dex 17, Con 15, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6

topic.para: The badger is a furry animal with a squat, powerful body. Its strong forelimbs are armed with long claws for digging. An adult badger is 2 to 3 feet long and weighs 25 to 35 pounds.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
Badgers attack with their sharp claws and teeth.

topic.name: Rage
topic.para: Rage (Ex): A badger that takes damage in combat flies into a berserk rage on its next turn, clawing and biting madly until either it or its opponent is dead. It gains +4 to Strength, +4 to Constitution, and -2 to Armor Class. The creature cannot end its rage voluntarily.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: A badger has a +4 racial bonus on Escape Artist checks.

topic.name: Bat
topic.para: Bat

cell.para: Str 1, Dex 15, Con 10, Int 2, Wis 14, Cha 4

topic.para: Bats are nocturnal flying mammals. The statistics presented here describe small, insectivorous bats.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
Blindsense (Ex): A bat notices and locates creatures within 20 feet. Opponents still have 100% concealment against a creature with blindsense.
Skills: *A bat has a +4 racial bonus on Spot and Listen checks. These bonuses are lost if its blindsense is negated.

topic.name: Bear, Black
topic.para: Bear, Black

cell.para: Str 19, Dex 13, Con 15, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6

topic.para: The black bear is a forest-dwelling omnivore that usually is not dangerous unless an interloper threatens its cubs or food supply.
Black bears can be pure black, blond, or cinnamon in color and are rarely more than 5 feet long.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
Black bears rip prey with their claws and teeth.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: A black bear has a +4 racial bonus on Swim checks.

topic.name: Bear, Brown
topic.para: Bear, Brown

cell.para: Str 27, Dex 13, Con 19, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6

topic.para: These massive carnivores weigh more than 1,800 pounds and stand nearly 9 feet tall when they rear up on their hind legs. They are bad-tempered and territorial. The brown bear's statistics can be used for almost any big bear, including the grizzly.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
A brown bear attacks mainly by tearing at opponents with its claws.

topic.name: Improved Grab
topic.para: Improved Grab (Ex): To use this ability, a brown bear must hit with a claw attack. It can then attempt to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: A brown bear has a +4 racial bonus on Swim checks.

topic.name: Bear, Polar
topic.para: Bear, Polar

cell.para: Str 27, Dex 13, Con 19, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6

topic.para: These long, lean carnivores are slightly taller than brown bears.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
Polar bears fight just as brown bears do.

topic.name: Improved Grab
topic.para: Improved Grab (Ex): To use this ability, a polar bear must hit with a claw attack. It can then attempt to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: A polar bear has a +8 racial bonus on any Swim check to perform some special action or avoid a hazard. It can always choose to take 10 on a Swim check, even if distracted or endangered. It can use the run action while swimming, provided it swims in a straight line. *A polar bear's white coat bestows a +12 racial bonus on Hide checks in snowy areas.

topic.name: Bison
topic.para: Bison

cell.para: Str 22, Dex 10, Con 16, Int 2, Wis 11, Cha 4

topic.para: These herd animals can be aggressive when protecting young and during the mating season, but they generally prefer flight to fighting. A bison stands more than 6 feet tall at the shoulder and is 9 to 12 feet long. It weigh 1,800 to 2,400 pounds. The bison's statistics can be used for almost any large herd animal.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat

topic.name: Stampede
topic.para: Stampede (Ex): A frightened herd of bison flees as a group in a random direction (but always away from the perceived source of danger). They literally run over anything of Large size or smaller that gets in their way, dealing 1d12 points of damage for each five bison in the herd (Reflex DC 18 half ). The save DC is Strength-based.

topic.name: Boar
topic.para: Boar

cell.para: Str 15, Dex 10, Con 17, Int 2, Wis 13, Cha 4

topic.para: Though not carnivores, these wild swine are bad-tempered and usually charge anyone who disturbs them. A boar is covered in coarse, grayish-black fur. Adult males are about 4 feet long and 3 feet high at the shoulder.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat

topic.name: Ferocity
topic.para: Ferocity (Ex): A boar is such a tenacious combatant that it continues to fight without penalty even while disabled or dying.

topic.name: Camel
topic.para: Camel

cell.para: Str 18, Dex 16, Con 14, Int 2, Wis 11, Cha 4

topic.para: Camels are known for their ability to travel long distances without food or water.

The statistics presented here are for the dromedary, or one-humped camel, which thrives in warm deserts. A dromedary stands about 7 feet tall at the shoulder, with its hump rising 1 foot higher. The two-humped, or Bactrian, camel is suited to cooler, rocky areas. It is stockier, slower (speed 40 feet), and has a higher Constitution score (16).

topic.name: Carrying Capacity
topic.para: Carrying Capacity: A light load for a camel is up to 300 pounds; a medium load, 301-600 pounds; and a heavy load, 601-900 pounds. A camel can drag 4,500 pounds.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
*A camel's bite is treated as a secondary attack and adds only half the camel's Strength bonus to the damage roll.

topic.name: Cat
topic.para: Cat

cell.para: Str 3, Dex 15, Con 10, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 7
Balance +10, Climb +6, Hide +14*, Jump +10, Listen +3, Move Silently +6, Spot +3

topic.para: The statistics presented here describe a common housecat.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
Cats prefer to sneak up on their prey.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: Cats have a +4 racial bonus on Climb, Hide, and Move Silently checks and a +8 racial bonus on Jump checks. Cats have a +8 racial bonus on Balance checks. They use their Dexterity modifier instead of their Strength modifier for Climb and Jump checks. *In areas of tall grass or heavy undergrowth, the Hide bonus rises to +8.

topic.name: Cheetah
topic.para: Cheetah

cell.para: Str 16, Dex 19, Con 15, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6

topic.para: Cheetahs are swift feline predators of the plains. A cheetah is 3 to 5 feet long and weighs 110 to 130 pounds.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
Cheetahs make sudden sprints to bring down prey.

topic.name: Trip
topic.para: Trip (Ex): A cheetah that hits with a claw or bite attack can attempt to trip the opponent (+3 check modifier) as a free action without making a touch attack or provoking an attack of opportunity. If the attempt fails, the opponent cannot react to trip the cheetah.

topic.name: Sprint
topic.para: Sprint (Ex): Once per hour, a cheetah can move ten times its normal speed (500 feet) when it makes a charge.

topic.name: Crocodile
topic.para: Crocodile

cell.para: Bite +6 melee (1d8+6) or tail slap +6 melee (1d12+6)
Bite +6 melee (1d8+6) or tail slap +6 melee (1d12+6)
Str 19, Dex 12, Con 17, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2

topic.para: Crocodiles are aggressive predators 11 to 12 feet long. They lie mostly submerged in rivers or marshes, with only their eyes and nostrils showing, waiting for prey to come within reach.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat

topic.name: Improved Grab
topic.para: Improved Grab (Ex): To use this ability, a crocodile must hit with its bite attack. It can then attempt to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity. If it wins the grapple check, the crocodile establishes a hold on the opponent with its mouth and drags it into deep water, attempting to pin it to the bottom.

topic.name: Hold Breath
topic.para: Hold Breath (Ex): A crocodile can hold its breath for a number of rounds equal to 4 x its Constitution score before it risks drowning.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: A crocodile has a +8 racial bonus on any Swim check to perform some special action or avoid a hazard. It can always choose to take 10 on a Swim check, even if distracted or endangered. It can use the run action while swimming, provided it swims in a straight line. *A crocodile gains a +4 racial bonus on Hide checks when in the water. Further, a crocodile can lie in the water with only its eyes and nostrils showing, gaining a +10 cover bonus on Hide checks.

topic.name: Crocodile, Giant
topic.para: Crocodile, Giant

cell.para: Bite +11 melee (2d8+12) or tail slap +11 melee (1d12+12)
Bite +11 melee (2d8+12) or tail slap +11 melee (1d12+12)
Str 27, Dex 12, Con 19, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2

topic.para: These huge creatures usually live in salt water and can be more than 20 feet long.
Giant crocodiles fight and behave like their smaller cousins.

topic.name: Dog
topic.para: Dog

cell.para: Str 13, Dex 17, Con 15, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6

topic.para: The statistics presented here describe a fairly small dog of about 20 to 50 pounds in weight. They also can be used for small wild canines such as coyotes, jackals, and African wild dogs.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
Dogs generally hunt in packs, chasing and exhausting prey until they can drag it down.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: Dogs have a +4 racial bonus on Jump checks. *Dogs have a +4 racial bonus on Survival checks when tracking by scent.

topic.name: Dog, Riding
topic.para: Dog, Riding

cell.para: Str 15, Dex 15, Con 15, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6

topic.para: This category includes working breeds such as collies, huskies, and St. Bernards.

topic.name: Carrying Capacity
topic.para: Carrying Capacity: A light load for a riding dog is up to 100 pounds; a medium load, 101-200 pounds; and a heavy load, 201-300 pounds. A riding dog can drag 1,500 pounds.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat

If trained for war, these animals can make trip attacks just as wolves do (see the Wolf entry). A riding dog can fight while carrying a rider, but the rider cannot also attack unless he or she succeeds on a Ride check.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: Riding dogs have a +4 racial bonus on Jump checks. *Riding dogs have a +4 racial bonus on Survival checks when tracking by scent.

topic.name: Donkey
topic.para: Donkey

cell.para: Str 10, Dex 13, Con 12, Int 2, Wis 11, Cha 4

topic.para: These long-eared, horselike creatures are surefooted and sturdy. The statistics presented here could also describe burros.

topic.name: Carrying Capacity
topic.para: Carrying Capacity: A light load for a donkey is up to 50 pounds; a medium load, 51-100 pounds; and a heavy load, 101-150 pounds. A donkey can drag 750 pounds.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
A donkey bites only when it has no way to escape.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: Donkeys have a +2 racial bonus on Balance checks.

topic.name: Eagle
topic.para: Eagle

cell.para: Str 10, Dex 15, Con 12, Int 2, Wis 14, Cha 6

topic.para: These birds of prey inhabit nearly every terrain and climate, though they all prefer high, secluded nesting spots.
A typical eagle is about 3 feet long and has a wingspan of about 7 feet. The statistics presented here can describe any similar-sized, diurnal bird of prey.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
Eagles dive at prey, raking with their powerful talons.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: Eagles have a +8 racial bonus on Spot checks.

topic.name: Elephant
topic.para: Elephant

cell.para: Slam +16 melee (2d6+10) and 2 stamps +11 melee (2d6+5); or gore +16 melee (2d8+15)
Str 30, Dex 10, Con 21, Int 2, Wis 13, Cha 7
Alertness, Endurance, Iron Will, Skill Focus (Listen)

topic.para: Massive herbivores of tropical lands, elephants are unpredictable creatures but nevertheless are sometimes used as mounts or beasts of burden.

This entry describes an African elephant. Indian elephants are slightly smaller and weaker (Strength 28), but more readily trained (Wisdom 15). These statistics can also represent prehistoric creatures such as mammoths and mastodons.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
Elephants tend to charge at threatening creatures.

topic.name: Trample
topic.para: Trample (Ex): Reflex half DC 25. The save DC is Strength-based.

topic.name: Hawk
topic.para: Hawk

cell.para: Str 6, Dex 17, Con 10, Int 2, Wis 14, Cha 6

topic.para: These creatures are similar to eagles but slightly smaller: 1 to 2 feet long, with wingspans of 6 feet or less.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
Hawks combine both talons into a single attack.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: Hawks have a +8 racial bonus on Spot checks.

topic.name: Horse
topic.para: Horse
Horses are widely domesticated for riding and as beasts of burden.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat

A horse not trained for war does not normally use its hooves to attack. Its hoof attack is treated as a secondary attack and adds only half the horse's Strength bonus to damage. (These secondary attacks are noted with an asterisk in the Attack and Full Attack entries for the heavy horse and the light horse.)

cell.para: Str 16, Dex 13, Con 15, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6

topic.para: The statistics presented here describe large breeds of working horses such as Clydesdales. These animals are usually ready for heavy work by age three. A heavy horse cannot fight while carrying a rider.

topic.name: Carrying Capacity
topic.para: Carrying Capacity: A light load for a heavy horse is up to 200 pounds; a medium load, 201-400 pounds; and a heavy load, 401-600 pounds. A heavy horse can drag 3,000 pounds.

cell.para: Str 14, Dex 13, Con 15, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6

topic.para: The statistics presented here describe smaller breeds of working horses such as quarter horses and Arabians as well as wild horses. These animals are usually ready for useful work by age two. A light horse cannot fight while carrying a rider.

topic.name: Carrying Capacity
topic.para: Carrying Capacity: A light load for a light horse is up to 150 pounds; a medium load, 151-300 pounds; and a heavy load, 301-450 pounds. A light horse can drag 2,250 pounds.

cell.para: Str 18, Dex 13, Con 17, Int 2, Wis 13, Cha 6

topic.para: These animals are similar to heavy horses but are trained and bred for strength and aggression. A heavy warhorse can fight while carrying a rider, but the rider cannot also attack unless he or she succeeds on a Ride check.

topic.name: Carrying Capacity
topic.para: Carrying Capacity: A light load for a heavy warhorse is up to 300 pounds; a medium load, 301-600 pounds; and a heavy load, 601-900 pounds. A heavy warhorse can drag 4,500 pounds.

cell.para: Str 16, Dex 13, Con 17, Int 2, Wis 13, Cha 6

topic.para: These animals or similar to light horses but are trained and bred for strength and aggression. They usually are not ready for warfare before age three. A light warhorse can fight while carrying a rider, but the rider cannot also attack unless he or she succeeds on a Ride check.

topic.name: Carrying Capacity
topic.para: Carrying Capacity: A light load for a light warhorse is up to 230 pounds; a medium load, 231-460 pounds; and a heavy load, 461-690 pounds. A light warhorse can drag 3,450 pounds.

topic.name: Hyena
topic.para: Hyena

cell.para: Str 14, Dex 15, Con 15, Int 2, Wis 13, Cha 6

topic.para: Hyenas are pack hunters infamous for their cunning and their unnerving vocalizations. The statistics presented here are for a striped hyena, which is about 3 feet long and weighs about 120 pounds.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
A favorite tactic is to send a few individuals against the foe's front while the rest of the pack circles and attacks from the flanks or rear.

topic.name: Trip
topic.para: Trip (Ex): A hyena that hits with its bite attack can attempt to trip the opponent (+2 check modifier) as a free action without making a touch attack or provoking an attack of opportunity. If the attempt fails, the opponent cannot react to trip the hyena.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: *Hyenas have a +4 racial bonus on Hide checks in areas of tall grass or heavy undergrowth.

topic.name: Leopard
topic.para: Leopard

cell.para: Str 16, Dex 19, Con 15, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6
Balance +12, Climb +11, Hide +8*, Jump +11, Listen +6, Move Silently +8, Spot +6

topic.para: These jungle cats are about 4 feet long and weigh about 120 pounds. They usually hunt at night. The statistics presented here can describe any feline of similar size, such as jaguars, panthers, and mountain lions.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat

topic.name: Improved Grab
topic.para: Improved Grab (Ex): To use this ability, a leopard must hit with its bite attack. It can then attempt to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity. If it wins the grapple check, it establishes a hold and can rake.

topic.name: Pounce
topic.para: Pounce (Ex): If a leopard charges a foe, it can make a full attack, including two rake attacks.

topic.name: Rake
topic.para: Rake (Ex): Attack bonus +6 melee, damage 1d3+1.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: Leopards have a +8 racial bonus on Jump checks and a +4 racial bonus on Hide and Move Silently checks. Leopards have a +8 racial bonus on Balance and Climb checks. A leopard can always choose to take 10 on a Climb check, even if rushed or threatened. *In areas of tall grass or heavy undergrowth, the Hide bonus improves to +8.

topic.name: Lion
topic.para: Lion

cell.para: Str 21, Dex 17, Con 15, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6
Balance +7, Hide +3*, Listen +5, Move Silently +11, Spot +5

topic.para: The statistics presented here describe a male African lion, which is 5 to 8 feet long and weighs 330 to 550 pounds. Females are slightly smaller but use the same statistics.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat

topic.name: Pounce
topic.para: Pounce (Ex): If a lion charges a foe, it can make a full attack, including two rake attacks.

topic.name: Improved Grab
topic.para: Improved Grab (Ex): To use this ability, a lion must hit with its bite attack. It can then attempt to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity. If it wins the grapple check, it establishes a hold and can rake.

topic.name: Rake
topic.para: Rake (Ex): Attack bonus +7 melee, damage 1d4+2.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: Lions have a +4 racial bonus on Balance, Hide, and Move Silently checks. *In areas of tall grass or heavy undergrowth, the Hide bonus improves to +12.

topic.name: Lizard
topic.para: Lizard

cell.para: Str 3, Dex 15, Con 10, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2

topic.para: The statistics presented here describe small, nonvenomous lizards of perhaps a foot or two in length, such as an iguana.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
Lizards prefer flight to combat, but they can bite painfully if there is no other option.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: Lizards have a +8 racial bonus on Balance checks. They also have a +8 racial bonus on Climb checks and can always choose to take 10 on Climb checks, even if rushed or threatened. Lizards use their Dexterity modifier instead of their Strength modifier for Climb checks.

topic.name: Lizard, Monitor
topic.para: Lizard, Monitor

cell.para: Str 17, Dex 15, Con 17, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2
Climb +7, Hide +6*, Listen +4, Move Silently +6, Spot +4, Swim +11

topic.para: This category includes fairly large, carnivorous lizards from 3 to 5 feet long.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
Monitor lizards can be aggressive, using their powerful jaws to tear at prey or enemies.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: A monitor lizard has a +8 racial bonus on any Swim check to perform some special action or avoid a hazard. It can always choose to take 10 on a Swim check, even if distracted or endangered. It can use the run action while swimming, provided it swims in a straight line. Monitor lizards have a +4 racial bonus on Hide and Move Silently checks. *In forested or overgrown areas, the Hide bonus improves to +8.

topic.name: Manta Ray
topic.para: Manta Ray

cell.para: Str 15, Dex 11, Con 10, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2

topic.para: These fish are nonaggressive and generally avoid contact with other creatures. They filter plankton and similar small organisms from the water through their gaping, toothless maws.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
*If threatened, a manta ray uses its size and weight to ram opponents. This is treated as a secondary attack.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: A manta ray has a +8 racial bonus on any Swim check to perform some special action or avoid a hazard. It can always choose to take 10 on a Swim check, even if distracted or endangered. It can use the run action while swimming, provided it swims in a straight line.

topic.name: Monkey
topic.para: Monkey

cell.para: Str 3, Dex 15, Con 10, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 5

topic.para: The statistics presented here can describe any arboreal monkey that is no bigger than a housecat, such as a colobus or capuchin.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
Monkeys generally flee into the safety of the trees, but if cornered can fight ferociously.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: Monkeys have a +8 racial bonus on Balance and Climb checks. They can always choose to take 10 on Climb checks, even if rushed or threatened. They use their Dexterity modifier instead of their Strength modifier for Climb checks.

topic.name: Mule
topic.para: Mule

cell.para: Str 16, Dex 13, Con 17, Int 2, Wis 11, Cha 6

topic.para: Mules are sterile crossbreeds of donkeys and horses. A mule is similar to a light horse, but slightly stronger and more agile.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
A mule's powerful kick can be dangerous.

topic.name: Carrying Capacity
topic.para: Carrying Capacity: A light load for a mule is up to 230 pounds; a medium load, 231-460 pounds; and a heavy load, 461-690 pounds. A mule can drag 3,450 pounds.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: Mules have a +2 racial bonus on Dexterity checks to avoid slipping or falling.

topic.name: Octopus
topic.para: Octopus

cell.para: Str 12, Dex 17, Con 11, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 3
Escape Artist +13, Hide +11, Listen +2, Spot +5, Swim +9

topic.para: These bottom-dwelling sea creatures are dangerous only to their prey. If disturbed, they usually try to escape.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat

topic.name: Improved Grab
topic.para: Improved Grab (Ex): To use this ability, an octopus must hit an opponent of any size with its arms attack. It can then attempt to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity. If it wins the grapple check, it establishes a hold and automatically deals bite damage.

topic.name: Ink Cloud
topic.para: Ink Cloud (Ex): An octopus can emit a cloud of jet-black ink 10 feet high by 10 feet wide by 10 feet long once per minute as a free action. The cloud provides total concealment, which the octopus normally uses to escape a losing fight. All vision within the cloud is obscured.

topic.name: Jet
topic.para: Jet (Ex): An octopus can jet backward once per round as a full-round action, at a speed of 200 feet. It must move in a straight line, but does not provoke attacks of opportunity while jetting.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: An octopus can change colors, giving it a +4 racial bonus on Hide checks. An octopus also can squeeze and contort its body, giving it a +10 racial bonus on Escape Artist checks. An octopus has a +8 racial bonus on any Swim check to perform some special action or avoid a hazard. It can always choose to take 10 on a Swim check, even if distracted or endangered. It can use the run action while swimming, provided it swims in a straight line.

topic.name: Octopus, Giant
topic.para: Octopus, Giant

cell.para: Str 20, Dex 15, Con 13, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 3
Escape Artist +12, Hide +12, Listen +4, Spot +6, Swim +13

topic.para: These creatures are aggressive and territorial hunters, with arms reaching 10 feet or more in length. Their tentacles are studded with barbs and sharp-edged suckers.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat

An opponent can attack a giant octopus's tentacles with a sunder attempt as if they were weapons. A giant octopus's tentacles have 10 hit points each. If a giant octopus is currently grappling a target with the tentacle that is being attacked, it usually uses another limb to make its attack of opportunity against the opponent making the sunder attempt. Severing one of a giant octopus's tentacles deals 5 points of damage to the creature. A giant octopus usually withdraws from combat if it loses four tentacles. The creature regrows severed limbs in 1d10+10 days.

topic.name: Constrict
topic.para: Constrict (Ex): A giant octopus deals 2d8+6 points of damage with a successful grapple check.

topic.name: Improved Grab
topic.para: Improved Grab (Ex): To use this ability, a giant octopus must hit an opponent of any size with a tentacle attack. It can then attempt to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity. If it wins the grapple check, it establishes a hold and can constrict.

topic.name: Ink Cloud
topic.para: Ink Cloud (Ex): A giant octopus can emit a cloud of jet-black ink 20 feet high by 20 feet wide by 20 feet long once per minute as a free action. The cloud provides total concealment, which the octopus normally uses to escape a losing fight. All vision within the cloud is obscured.

topic.name: Jet
topic.para: Jet (Ex): A giant octopus can jet backward once per round as a full-round action, at a speed of 200 feet. It must move in a straight line, but does not provoke attacks of opportunity while jetting.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: A giant octopus can change colors, giving it a +4 racial bonus on Hide checks. A giant octopus also can squeeze and contort its body, giving it a +10 racial bonus on Escape Artist checks. A giant octopus has a +8 racial bonus on any Swim check to perform some special action or avoid a hazard. It can always choose to take 10 on a Swim check, even if distracted or endangered. It can use the run action while swimming, provided it swims in a straight line.

topic.name: Owl
topic.para: Owl

cell.para: Str 4, Dex 17, Con 10, Int 2, Wis 14, Cha 4

topic.para: The statistics presented here describe nocturnal birds of prey from 1 to 2 feet long, with wingspans up to 6 feet. They combine both talons into a single attack.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
Owls swoop quietly down onto prey, attacking with their powerful talons.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: Owls have a +8 racial bonus on Listen checks and a +14 racial bonus on Move Silently checks. *They have a +8 racial bonus on Spot checks in areas of shadowy illumination.

topic.name: Pony
topic.para: Pony

cell.para: Str 13, Dex 13, Con 12, Int 2, Wis 11, Cha 4

topic.para: The statistics presented here describe a small horse, under 5 feet tall at the shoulder. Ponies are otherwise similar to light horses and cannot fight while carrying a rider.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
*A pony not trained for war does not normally use its hooves to attack but rather to run. Its hoof attack is treated as a secondary attack and adds only half the pony's Strength bonus to damage.

topic.name: Carrying Capacity
topic.para: Carrying Capacity: A light load for a pony is up to 75 pounds; a medium load, 76-150 pounds; and a heavy load, 151-225 pounds. A pony can drag 1,125 pounds.

topic.name: Pony, War
topic.para: Pony, War

cell.para: Str 15, Dex 13, Con 14, Int 2, Wis 11, Cha 4

topic.para: Warponies are bred for strength and aggression, and are similar to light warhorses.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
A warpony can fight while carrying a rider, but the rider cannot also attack unless he or she succeeds on a Ride check.

topic.name: Carrying Capacity
topic.para: Carrying Capacity: A light load for a warpony is up to 100 pounds; a medium load, 101-200 pounds; and a heavy load, 201-300 pounds. A warpony can drag 1,500 pounds.

topic.name: Porpoise
topic.para: Porpoise

cell.para: Blindsight 120 ft., hold breath, low-light vision
Str 11, Dex 17, Con 13, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6

topic.para: Porpoises are mammals that tend to be playful, friendly, and helpful. A typical porpoise is 4 to 6 feet long and weighs 110 to 160 pounds. The statistics presented here can describe any small whale of similar size.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat

topic.name: Blindsight
topic.para: Blindsight (Ex): Porpoises can 'see' by emitting high-frequency sounds, inaudible to most other creatures, that allow them to locate objects and creatures within 120 feet. A silence spell negates this and forces the porpoise to rely on its vision, which is approximately as good as a human's.

topic.name: Hold Breath
topic.para: Hold Breath (Ex): A porpoise can hold its breath for a number of rounds equal to 6 x ?its Constitution score before it risks drowning.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: A porpoise has a +8 racial bonus on any Swim check to perform some special action or avoid a hazard. It can always choose to take 10 on a Swim check, even if distracted or endangered. It can use the run action while swimming, provided it swims in a straight line. *A porpoise has a +4 racial bonus on Spot and Listen checks. These bonuses are lost if its blindsight is negated.

topic.name: Rat
topic.para: Rat

cell.para: 15 ft. (3 squares), climb 15 ft., swim 15 ft.
Str 2, Dex 15, Con 10, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 2
Balance +10, Climb +12, Hide +14, Move Silently +10, Swim +10

topic.para: These omnivorous rodents thrive almost anywhere.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
Rats usually run away. They bite only as a last resort.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: Rats have a +4 racial bonus on Hide and Move Silently checks, and a +8 racial bonus on Balance, Climb, and Swim checks. A rat can always choose to take 10 on Climb checks, even if rushed or threatened. A rat uses its Dexterity modifier instead of its Strength modifier for Climb and Swim checks. A rat has a +8 racial bonus on any Swim check to perform some special action or avoid a hazard. It can always choose to take 10 on a Swim check, even if distracted or endangered. It can use the run action while swimming, provided it swims in a straight line.

topic.name: Raven
topic.para: Raven

cell.para: Str 1, Dex 15, Con 10, Int 2, Wis 14, Cha 6

topic.para: These glossy black birds are about 2 feet long and have wingspans of about 4 feet. They combine both claws into a single attack. The statistics presented here can describe most nonpredatory birds of similar size.

topic.name: Rhinoceros
topic.para: Rhinoceros

cell.para: Str 26, Dex 10, Con 21, Int 2, Wis 13, Cha 2

topic.para: The rhinoceros is infamous for its bad temper and willingness to charge intruders.

The statistics presented here are based on the African black rhino, which is 6 to 14 feet long, 3 to 6 feet high at the shoulder, and weighs up to 6,000 pounds. These statistics can describe any herbivore of similar size and similar natural weapons (antlers, horns, tusks, or the like).

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
When it is harassed or annoyed, a rhinoceros lowers its head and charges.

topic.name: Powerful Charge
topic.para: Powerful Charge (Ex): A rhinoceros deals 4d6+24 points of damage when it makes a charge.

topic.name: Shark
topic.para: Shark

cell.para: Str 13, Dex 15, Con 13, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2
Str 17, Dex 15, Con 13, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2
Str 21, Dex 15, Con 15, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2
Alertness, Great Fortitude, Improved Initiative, Iron Will

topic.para: These carnivorous fish are aggressive and liable to make unprovoked attacks against anything that approaches them. Smaller sharks are from 5 to 8 feet long and not usually dangerous to creatures other than their prey. Large sharks can reach around 15 feet in length and are a serious threat. Huge sharks are true monsters, like great whites, that can exceed 20 feet in length.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
Sharks circle and observe potential prey, then dart in and bite with their powerful jaws.

topic.name: Blindsense
topic.para: Blindsense (Ex): A shark can locate creatures underwater within a 30-foot radius. This ability works only when the shark is underwater.

topic.name: Keen Scent
topic.para: Keen Scent (Ex): A shark can notice creatures by scent in a 180-foot radius and detect blood in the water at ranges of up to a mile.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: A shark has a +8 racial bonus on any Swim check to perform some special action or avoid a hazard. It can always choose to take 10 on a Swim check, even if distracted or endangered. It can use the run action while swimming, provided it swims in a straight line.

topic.name: Snake
topic.para: Snake
Snakes usually are not aggressive and flee when confronted.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: Snakes have a +4 racial bonus on Hide, Listen, and Spot checks and a +8 racial bonus on Balance and Climb checks. A snake can always choose to take 10 on a Climb check, even if rushed or threatened. Snakes use either their Strength modifier or Dexterity modifier for Climb checks, whichever is higher. A snake has a +8 racial bonus on any Swim check to perform some special action or avoid a hazard. It can always choose to take 10 on a Swim check, even if distracted or endangered. It can use the run action while swimming, provided it swims in a straight line.

topic.name: Constrictor Snake
topic.para: Constrictor Snake

cell.para: 20 ft. (4 squares), climb 20 ft., swim 20 ft.
Str 17, Dex 17, Con 13, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2
Balance +11, Climb +14, Hide +10, Listen +7, Spot +7, Swim +11

topic.para: Constrictor snakes usually are not aggressive and flee when confronted. They hunt for food but do not attempt to make a meal out of any creature that is too large to constrict.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
Constrictor snakes hunt by grabbing prey with their mouths and then squeezing it with their powerful bodies.

topic.name: Constrict
topic.para: Constrict (Ex): On a successful grapple check, a constrictor snake deals 1d3+4 points of damage.

topic.name: Improved Grab
topic.para: Improved Grab (Ex): To use this ability, a constrictor snake must hit with its bite attack. It can then attempt to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity. If it wins the grapple check, it establishes a hold and can constrict.

topic.name: Constrictor Snake, Giant
topic.para: Constrictor Snake, Giant

cell.para: 20 ft. (4 squares), climb 20 ft., swim 20 ft.
Str 25, Dex 17, Con 13, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2
Balance +11, Climb +17, Hide +10, Listen +9, Spot +9, Swim +16

topic.para: Giant constrictor snakes are more aggressive than their smaller cousins, principally because they need a great amount of food to survive.

topic.name: Viper Snake
topic.para: Viper Snake

cell.para: 15 ft. (3 squares), climb 15 ft., swim 15 ft.
20 ft. (4 squares), climb 20 ft., swim 20 ft.
Str 4, Dex 17, Con 11, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2
Str 6, Dex 17, Con 11, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2
Balance +11, Climb +11, Hide +15, Listen +6, Spot +6, Swim +5
Balance +11, Climb +11, Hide +11, Listen +7, Spot +7, Swim +6
20 ft. (4 squares), climb 20 ft., swim 20 ft.
20 ft. (4 squares), climb 20 ft., swim 20 ft.
20 ft. (4 squares), climb 20 ft., swim 20 ft.
Str 8, Dex 17, Con 11, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2
Str 10, Dex 17, Con 11, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2
Str 16, Dex 15, Con 13, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2
Balance +11, Climb +11, Hide +12, Listen +5, Spot +5, Swim +7
Balance +11, Climb +11, Hide +8, Listen +5, Spot +6, Swim +8
Balance +10, Climb +11, Hide +3, Listen +7, Spot +7, Swim +11

topic.para: These creatures range widely in size. They are not particularly aggressive, but will often lash out with a bite attack before attempting to retreat.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
Viper snakes rely on their venomous bite to kill prey and defend themselves.

Poison (Ex): A viper snake has a poisonous bite that deals initial and secondary damage of 1d6 Con. The save DC varies by the snake's size, as shown on the table below. The save DCs are Constitution-based.

topic.name: Squid
topic.para: Squid

cell.para: Str 14, Dex 17, Con 11, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2

topic.para: These free-swimming mollusks are fairly aggressive. They are more feared than sharks in some locales.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat

topic.name: Improved Grab
topic.para: Improved Grab (Ex): To use this ability, a squid must hit an opponent of any size with its arms attack. It can then attempt to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity. If it wins the grapple check, it establishes a hold and automatically deals bite damage. *A squid has a +4 racial bonus on grapple checks.

topic.name: Ink Cloud
topic.para: Ink Cloud (Ex): A squid can emit a cloud of jet-black ink 10 feet high by 10 feet wide by 10 feet long once per minute as a free action. The cloud provides total concealment, which the squid normally uses to escape a losing fight. All vision within the cloud is obscured.

topic.name: Jet
topic.para: Jet (Ex): A squid can jet backward once per round as a full-round action, at a speed of 240 feet. It must move in a straight line, but does not provoke attacks of opportunity while jetting.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: A squid has a +8 racial bonus on any Swim check to perform some special action or avoid a hazard. It can always choose to take 10 on a Swim check, even if distracted or endangered. It can use the run action while swimming, provided it swims in a straight line

topic.name: Squid, Giant
topic.para: Squid, Giant

cell.para: Str 26, Dex 17, Con 13, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2

topic.para: These voracious creatures can have bodies more than 20 feet long and attack almost anything they meet.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat

An opponent can attack a giant squid's tentacles with a sunder attempt as if they were weapons. A giant squid's tentacles have 10 hit points each. If a giant squid is currently grappling a target with the tentacle that is being attacked, it usually uses another limb to make its attack of opportunity against the opponent making the sunder attempt. Severing one of a giant squid's tentacles deals 5 points of damage to the creature. A giant squid usually withdraws from combat if it loses five tentacles. The creature regrows severed limbs in 1d10+10 days.

topic.name: Constrict
topic.para: Constrict (Ex): A giant squid deals 1d6+8 points of damage with a successful grapple check.

topic.name: Improved Grab
topic.para: Improved Grab (Ex): To use this ability, a giant squid must hit an opponent of any size with a tentacle attack. It can then attempt to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity. If it wins the grapple check, it establishes a hold and can constrict. *A giant squid has a +4 racial bonus on grapple checks.

topic.name: Ink Cloud
topic.para: Ink Cloud (Ex): A giant squid can emit a cloud of jet-black ink 20 feet high by 20 feet wide by 20 feet long once per minute as a free action. The cloud provides total concealment, which the squid normally uses to escape a losing fight. All vision within the cloud is obscured.

topic.name: Jet
topic.para: Jet (Ex): A giant squid can jet backward once per round as a full-round action, at a speed of 320 feet. It must move in a straight line, but does not provoke attacks of opportunity while jetting.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: A giant squid has a +8 racial bonus on any Swim check to perform some special action or avoid a hazard. It can always choose to take 10 on a Swim check, even if distracted or endangered. It can use the run action while swimming, provided it swims in a straight line.

topic.name: Tiger
topic.para: Tiger

cell.para: Str 23, Dex 15, Con 17, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6
Balance +6, Hide +3*, Listen +3, Move Silently +9, Spot +3, Swim +11
Alertness, Improved Natural Weapon (bite), and Improved Natural Weapon (claw).

topic.para: These great cats stand more than 3 feet tall at the shoulder and are about 9 feet long. They weigh from 400 to 600 pounds.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat

topic.name: Improved Grab
topic.para: Improved Grab (Ex): To use this ability, a tiger must hit with a claw or bite attack. It can then attempt to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity. If it wins the grapple check, it establishes a hold and can rake.

topic.name: Pounce
topic.para: Pounce (Ex): If a tiger charges a foe, it can make a full attack, including two rake attacks.

topic.name: Rake
topic.para: Rake (Ex): Attack bonus +9 melee, damage 1d8+3.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: Tigers have a +4 racial bonus on Balance, Hide, and Move Silently checks. *In areas of tall grass or heavy undergrowth, the Hide bonus improves to +8.

topic.name: Toad
topic.para: Toad

cell.para: Str 1, Dex 12, Con 11, Int 1, Wis 14, Cha 4

topic.para: These diminutive amphibians are innocuous and beneficial, since they eat insects.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: A toad's coloration gives it a +4 racial bonus on Hide checks.

topic.name: Weasel
topic.para: Weasel

cell.para: Str 3, Dex 15, Con 10, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 5
Balance +10, Climb +10, Hide +11, Move Silently +8, Spot +3

topic.para: These little mammals are aggressive predators but usually confine themselves to smaller prey. The statistics presented here can also apply to ferrets.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat

topic.name: Attach
topic.para: Attach (Ex): If a weasel hits with a bite attack, it uses its powerful jaws to latch onto the opponent's body and automatically deals bite damage each round it remains attached. An attached weasel loses its Dexterity bonus to Armor Class and has an AC of 12. An attached weasel can be struck with a weapon or grappled itself. To remove an attached weasel through grappling, the opponent must achieve a pin against the creature.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: Weasels have a +4 racial bonus on Move Silently checks and a +8 racial bonus on Balance and Climb checks. They use their Dexterity modifier for Climb checks. A weasel can always choose to take 10 on a Climb check, even if rushed or threatened.

topic.name: Whale
topic.para: Whale

Some varieties of these seagoing mammals are among the largest animals known. Relatively small whales (such as the orca presented here) can be vicious predators, attacking virtually anything they detect.

topic.name: Blindsight
topic.para: Blindsight (Ex): Whales can 'see' by emitting high-frequency sounds, inaudible to most other creatures, that allow them to locate objects and creatures within 120 feet. A silence spell negates this and forces the whale to rely on its vision, which is approximately as good as a human's.

topic.name: Hold Breath
topic.para: Hold Breath (Ex): A whale can hold its breath for a number of rounds equal to 8 x ?its Constitution score before it risks drowning.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: A whale has a +8 racial bonus on any Swim check to perform some special action or avoid a hazard. It can always choose to take 10 on a Swim check, even if distracted or endangered. It can use the run action while swimming, provided it swims in a straight line. *A whale has a +4 racial bonus on Spot and Listen checks. These bonuses are lost if its blindsight is negated.

cell.para: Blindsight 120 ft., hold breath, low-light vision
Str 35, Dex 13, Con 22, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6

topic.para: The statistics here describe a plankton-feeding whale between 30 and 60 feet long, such as gray, humpback, and right whales. These massive creatures are surprisingly gentle. If harassed or provoked, they are as likely to flee as they are to retaliate.

cell.para: Bite +17 melee (4d6+12) and tail slap +12 melee (1d8+6)
Blindsight 120 ft., hold breath, low-light vision
Str 35, Dex 13, Con 24, Int 2, Wis 14, Cha 6
Alertness, Diehard, Endurance, Improved Natural Attack (bite), Toughness

topic.para: Also known as sperm whales, these creatures can be up to 60 feet long. They prey on giant squids.

cell.para: Blindsight 120 ft., hold breath, low-light vision
Str 27, Dex 15, Con 21, Int 2, Wis 14, Cha 6

topic.para: These ferocious creatures are about 30 feet long. They eat fish, squid, seals, and other whales.

topic.name: Wolf
topic.para: Wolf

cell.para: Str 13, Dex 15, Con 15, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6
Hide +2, Listen +3, Move Silently +3, Spot +3, Survival +1*

topic.para: Wolves are pack hunters known for their persistence and cunning.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat
A favorite tactic is to send a few individuals against the foe's front while the rest of the pack circles and attacks from the flanks or rear.

topic.name: Trip
topic.para: Trip (Ex): A wolf that hits with a bite attack can attempt to trip the opponent (+1 check modifier) as a free action without making a touch attack or provoking an attack of opportunity. If the attempt fails, the opponent cannot react to trip the wolf.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: *Wolves have a +4 racial bonus on Survival checks when tracking by scent.

topic.name: Wolverine
topic.para: Wolverine

cell.para: 30 ft. (6 squares), burrow 10 ft., climb 10 ft.
Str 14, Dex 15, Con 19, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 10

topic.para: These creatures are similar to badgers but are bigger, stronger, and even more ferocious.

topic.name: Combat
topic.para: Combat

topic.name: Rage
topic.para: Rage (Ex): A wolverine that takes damage in combat flies into a berserk rage on its next turn, clawing and biting madly until either it or its opponent is dead. It gains +4 to Strength, +4 to Constitution, and -2 to Armor Class. The creature cannot end its rage voluntarily.

topic.name: Skills
topic.para: Skills: Wolverines have a +8 racial bonus on Climb checks and can always choose to take 10 on Climb checks, even if rushed or threatened.
